reviews.review_msg: JFC ! JFC! JFC ! Not as bad as I thought it would be, some reviews are exaggerated.
He was such a great prof, his exams were just like the practice ;) would recommend - Sam Bok
He was such a good prof during lectures. I really paid attention and understood everything he said! Highly recommend - Chase Kalanchey

ok tbh he isn't too bad and from what ive heard from his past courses he has improved a lot. midterms and finals were only worth 15% each so there was a heavier emphasize on assignments which were easy overall. the class avg was pretty high and he tells you what written questions are gonna be on his exams.

The midterms weren't too difficult and focused on concepts covered in the review lecture. The only thing I was disappointed by was the scaling down. The grading scheme was based on the class average, so a 90% translated to an A-. But overall, jf was a great prof and I'm glad I took his class.
Very accommodating and kind Prof. He made the exams worth only 15% each which was nice. Overall he's improved a lot and made the course enjoyable. I no longer hate physics

This professor reused past midterms word-for-word, inflating the class average. He then made the final excessively difficult and raised grade boundaries, making an A+ disproportionately harder to earn. Additionally, his frequent mistakes in worked examples during lecture further confused students.

I've had him for both physics 100 and 102 and there's 100% been an improvement in his teaching. I think he gets too much hate. A lot of students don't take the time to really understand concepts but hope on seeing the exact same questions on exams. (Ps if you think something is marked wrong the TA's are very helpful)

He is honestly not a tough grader, i found his exams very fair. He also does give us hints on what we could expect on the exam. I feel like he tries his best to explain the concepts. His homework questions are very helpful when it comes to studying for the exams. Overall a decent professor.

He has improved drastically in his ways of teaching from last semester. There are some issues still in the examples where he will skip a few steps, and sometimes the midterm questions (MC) are pretty hard. Also the person complaining about their learning being ruined because other people did well on the test needs to grow up and get a life or job

I was hesitant at first to take him, but he's good. He barely makes mistake, but will correct himself and fix it.  Additionally, he hinted us the written questions on midterm 1 which was quite helpful when studying, especially since I have so much going on. So to the one person complaining about him defeating the purpose of learning, deal with it.

JF, the class is not going to be happy when their 90% grade gets curved down two letter grades. Please don't reuse the exams and please don't tell the class what questions are going to be on the exam as that defeats the entire point and process of learning. Thanks for being a kind guy.

The reason the first midterm had a crazy high average of ~80% is that JF reused the EXACT same midterm as last semester and the majority of the class shared and viewed the exact answer key to the midterm prior to the exam, which is clear from the exam average. Please JF do not reuse you're old exams and punish the students trying to learn honestly.

JF has changed, don't listen to the bad reviews. He does worked examples in advance so he doesn't make mistakes anymore. His exams are very fair and not hard at all, most of your course grade ~30% comes from easy participation marks (iclicker/tut)

I'm not good at physics and I struggled in this course, but he's not as bad as everyone says. Very reasonable grade scheme, half of your grade is assignments and tutorials.The only thing is his slides are not as easy to follow and formulas should be outlined a bit better. He's overall a very nice prof, remember to read your textbook

JF is pretty chill with his grading and assignments. His examples in lectures and homework match the exams (for the most part). To be honest out of the first year classes . I found that I enjoyed this the most. I think his bad ratings for physics 100 is because the people in that class are learning physics for the first time and are first years.

I have very mixed opinions on this prof. I honestly found the course quite simple and straightforward, and thought i was doing very well throughout. I ended up with a 92% in this course just to find out after the final that he curves the course, lowering my grade. I really wish he would've mentioned this prior.
Terrible. Said numerous times he will adjusting the grading scale, but is all talk. Not a good prof at all and is one of the worst explainers
decent prof for a physics course

Its not that JF doesnt know his stuff, or that he isnt a caring prof, he cares a lot it seems. However he confuses himself in lecture and I think it would be nice if he had better slides to highlights the necessary equations needed. His tests are fair though, and I wouldn't say its a hard class. You just have to learn outside of lecture more

Some of the reviews are fake, and the students are blamed in each one.This professor is honestly the worst one yet.I enjoyed physics but all my passion was gone once JFC opened his mouth and confused everyone.He is ALWAYS confused by his examples.If you want to take a gamble and take this class, be my guest. You will be left confused and frustrated
So messy and doesn't know what he's doing himself. Makes me so sad being in his class.

He is well aware that he doesn't need to pass a certain amount of the class, so he refuses to be a better prof. Unfortunately, he doesn't take feedback and put it to use. He has the potential to be a good professor and seems like a nice person. I can't remember a time when he did a question right. He always 'winged it'.

just avoid at all costs. literally save yourself. you will learn nothing in this class and you will be confused over topics that shouldnt be too difficult to understand. he just laughs during lectures and says "wow i explained that really badly/confusingly". LIKE YEAH YOU DID. UR COOKED IF U TAKE PHYS WITH JFC

I honestly have nothing nice to say that wouldn't get removed. He is super underprepared. If youre reading this and doing course selection, please spare yourself and just wait another semester to take phy102. It seriously isnt worth it taking it with JFC. Save your money and save your time. The average for our midterm was awful He refuses to curve.

He's always unprepared for his lectures, makes multiple mistakes on his examples and will never finish them because he always gets confused when he's halfway writing them. He says “I don't really understand this concept” often. His midterm had multiple written questions that he wasn't able to finish in class and was too long for the time given.

Unfortunately, MANY of the reviews were deleted. 
I do think he means well, but he isn't very certain when it comes to his own questions and tends to make tons mistakes. When students give feedback, he tends to be defensive and take our in put with a grain of salt.
Exams are tight for time and are never completed 100% in the given time.
Jean has an inability to teach key concepts that should be straightforward to understand. I am unsure where the 70 1 star reviews went but he deserves every one of them.
NICEEE just do iclicker questions all class

It's unfortunate that there is something going on behind the scenes. Jean does not know how to teach. He confuses himself on his own examples and we leave reviews and they are being removed. He can't face the consequences of his actions so he try's to cover his actions to make himself look better.
worst professor ever. too much hw and hw is super hard. doesn't explain nothing beneficial in lecture. don't even know what he's saying half the time. worst experience of my life
Horrible professor, do not take any physics course with him.
Save yourself. If you see him teaching your course good luck. You are gonna need it a lot.
best in the game literally
No way our tuition is going to this.

This is the worst class I have ever taken. He does not teach and makes us do TONS of homework. The textbook is the only way to learn. All he does in class is mess up examples and reviews bridge questions.

Prof is unable to explain concepts clearly. Instead, he overcomplicates everything and makes it all so, so confusing. It is unbearable sitting through his class. Physics is already a challenging subject within itself. Top that with a professor who is confused about what's written on his own slides, and an unreasonably large amount of homework.
I do not like him.

Respectfully, the worst professor I've ever had. Can't simply explain what is being taught in class and I doubt he prepares his lectures as sometimes he can't explain basic questions himself. In class examples are usually overly complex. If you have this class with prof Caron be prepared to learn everything yourself.
Just absolutely horrible avoid at all costs. He doesn't know how to teach. Hes lost all the time.
He's unfortunately terrible

The lectures are very short with little information actually taught. Majority of the class is purely demos that are not necessary. The midterm was NOTHING like the homework and questions we went through in class or tutorials. There were MULTIPLE mistakes in the midterm which is insane to me. I learnt more in physics 11 then I did with him...

after he stated that he doesn't curve grades at all, despite the entire class doing poorly, makes me think he geniunely doesn't care about his students. the midterm exam was made with errors, and if you didn't catch them in time, then you would face the consequences. he also overcomplicates questions that could be handled in a simpler manner

He does not know what he's teaching over 90% of the time. His test even he cannot solve I bet you 100% he's crazy bad like you know more going into his course than going out of it. He does not even understand the material to be teaching it. Makes so many mistakes while teaching and gets corrected by students all the time. Terrible terrible terrible
The day before an exam, and he created and solved a question that included concepts irrelevant to our midterm. Nice hairline buddy.
He lets the online textbook do all the work and just sits there in lecture telling you to do the online stuff. Absolutely worthless

do not recommend! he gets confused during lecture, and i think he forgets we are there most of the time. he will just go through problems super quickly as if he is doing a test. i learned nothing from him and have been relying on the textbook. peer reviews are also not helpful because none of us know what's happening.

Cannot explain in a cohesive manner. Will skip concepts most of the time. Does not pay attention to what we learned that class before and assumes we are almighty all-knowing beings most of the time. Gives out a lot of homework that are due on the same day, and to add salt, lecture AND tutorial attendance is MANDATORY (and graded from rubrics)......
Can not explain simple key concepts. Do not take
Horrible at explaining
Not good at explaining things in lecture

JF is a really nice guy and tries to incorporate class feedback but he is very difficult to understand and follow in his lectures. The exams were much more difficult than the homework/textbook examples and therefore very difficult to study for.

This course was unnecessarily difficult and painful to get through. He was a very nice professor but I would not recommend taking this course with him. Attendance was mandatory for iClicker and we used Achieve for pre-lectures and assignments which turned out to be the only way I could somewhat learn the material.
Can't think of anything nice enough that won't get my rating removed

I have nothing personal against JFC, I think he's a really nice person and has the best intentions but he often gets confused with his own slides or written explanations or he back tracks so much in his answers that you get lost in how to even solve them. Written questions in exams often felt out of the scope of what we learned.

Goes well beyond the scope of the course materials, uses examples that not many would relate to or understand, goes to length to show a full equation then confusingly reduce it down to the simpler one, did not supply a rigid formula sheet. Give him feedback, but self-study for the most part

Dr. Caron did an okay job in his second semester of teaching. The class felt pretty disjointed with no clear beginnings/endings of topics, but the topics were fairly interesting. He often used words that I just don't understand, and the exam material did not reflect our practice material. He was caring towards students though.

I can confidently say that the majority of the class felt like JFC was not it. Lectures were not useful, as he spent the majority of the time doing bridge assignment questions/iclicker questions (which are a complete scam to all students. Any worked examples which we rarely did were difficult to follow because of his messy writing. Exams were tough

take this with a grain of salt because i hate physics. i did not find the lectures helpful and iclicker was worth 10%. the exam material is significantly harder than practice. homework assignments are peer graded which i never knew if i was doing right. before this course, i was above a 3.5. i am going to retake this course with a better prof.

JF's method of teaching was not very effective in my opinion. He spent too long doing demos that weren't clear to most of the class. Exam questions were very difficult and often didn't correlate with the material we learned in class. Exams were also unfair in the sense that there were too many questions and not enough time.

JF was such a difficult prof. He always did demo's that wasted our time and were very irrelevant on the course material. He never understood his lecture slides and it was hard to gather information as his slides were demo/picture heavy. Exams were tough and not like the lecture material at all.

He is good at taking criticism and following what the students want within reason through feedback quizzes. Midterms are super hard. homework is the same as any other physics class. Peer-review assignment format is interesting and helpful at times. He is caring, its just the exams:(

He goes over bridge questions wasting time instead of going over questions that he would put on exams. His knowledge of physics was subpar so that was why he confused himself most of the time. As for his lectures, he should save them for his clown career, and good physics professors should look out because professor-not-so-good is in the school.2/2

JF didn't really seem to know how to teach. All he did during lectures were demos and confusing himself. Rarely any of the content correlates with the materials tested yet he gives out extremely difficult problems on exams and assignments. Final exam was long but had a mix of MC and written, but he crossed out some questions, making it shorter.1/2.

self taught the entire course! Final questions were beyond the scope of this first level phys course. I personally think taking with him made it 1000 times worse as I am not a physics major. avoid at all cost!

He is a very nice guy but he is an awful professor. He confuses himself with his own lecture slides, and is not confident enough to be teaching it seems. The entire class seems to have the same feelings towards him, which makes me think he should reconsider his teaching style.

He seems inexperienced. He's confused about his own lecture slides at times and his methods of teaching are not the best. He goes through written problems super quickly cuz he prewrites them instead of handwriting during lectures which makes it hard to follow. The exams are way too long and hard and not related to problems from class.

This professor lacks experience in his field. He doesn't know how to properly plan his lectures according to current course material. Home work is completely different than the examples gone over in class. Although he is approachable and accommodating. All worked problems are completed before class so no calculations are done during class.

He is a nice prof but the material he teaches in class does not correlate with his homework, especially the written assignments. He gives us so much work to do outside of class, which takes time away from our other courses, and when you finally understand the homework material and go into the midterms, it differs from what we have studied.
Horrible

Does not post lecture slides because "its better for students to take handwritten notes". Everyone takes pictures of each slide that he goes through in class, so maybe he should reflect on his strategy of not posting slides. Exams are contradictory to what he teaches in class. He's himself confused about the material half of the time.

This professor does not know how to teach and confuses himself half the time in lectures. There is barely any material to study because he doesn't even give us lecture slides or that many practice problems. To show how difficult the exams are, he had to make the last question of an exam a bonus in order to make the average not a failing grade.

Is a nice person but is not very familiar with teaching. Lecture slides are useless and hard to follow and live examples are sometimes irrelevant. Exams ares not made with keeping the time we have to write them in mind.

Exam resources (answer keys to written hw, achieve practice problems and tutorial answers) posted a day before the midterm. The midterm review lecture was not very helpful. It's important to do your pre-lecture work to understand what's taught in class. He is nice/approachable and incorporates a stretching break in between lectures which is great.

- pro: stretching break + nice person
- con: takes feedback too seriously, messy writing, lectures are not helpful unless u learn everything from the pre-lec, exams get no formula sheet, iclickers vary (1-rapid fire) per class, explanations are confusing and worked examples he does wrong 80% of the time, exam resources given one day before exam
